result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony-Thomas Lacy Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber Privileges and Good Time Credit granted.  Credit for prior time served of 5 days also granted.

Case Called @ 11:35 AM: Defendant Anthony-Thomas Lacy Miller in court with attorney Bryan D. Keberlein.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA - probation not an option due to residency in State of Michigan.  Def and counsel concur w/recital.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court accepts State's Motion to Amend Ct 1 to Misd Level POT w/PTAC Plea:  NC  Plea Ct 2 w/PTAC:  NC Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Ct 1:  90 days WCJ - Report: 11/1/14 @ 8:00 PM - may report earlier if desired, GT and TS credit of 5 days, Huber; Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge.  Ct 2:  30 days WCJ, concurrent to Ct 1; Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 5, 2014 at 11:30 am.

10:30 am case called. Attorney Bryan D. Keberlein in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Keberlein regarding non-appearance. Offer to resolve has been accepted by defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.
